repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: Hi, I'm not sure if the behavior I'm documenting here is actually intentional, or is meant to be guaranteed to users, but it does seem intuitive, and does match the behavior I've seen when experimenting, so I decided to create a PR in case it's worth mentioning in the docs

comment_data.body: I'm also not sure about this help tag. Maybe `editorconfig` should come first? Maybe `*-and-*`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,4 +86,11 @@ Example: >lua
       vim.b[bufnr].foo = val
     end
 <
+
+EditorConfig overrides filetype plugins           *ftplugin-vs-editorconfig*

comment_data.body: editorconfig-vs-ftplugin or editorconfig-and-ftplugin would be better.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,4 +86,11 @@ Example: >lua
       vim.b[bufnr].foo = val
     end
 <
+
+EditorConfig overrides filetype plugins           *ftplugin-vs-editorconfig*

comment_data.body:
I don't think this needs a separate section or its own tag. I would just update the sentence near the beginning of the help file.

For example, change "When a file is opened" to "When a file is opened, after running |ftplugin|s,".
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,4 +86,11 @@ Example: >lua
       vim.b[bufnr].foo = val
     end
 <
+
+EditorConfig overrides filetype plugins           *editorconfig-vs-ftplugin*

comment_data.body:
> For example, change \"When a file is opened\" to \"When a file is opened, after running |ftplugin|s,\".

Ooh, nice. I have much to learn about technical documentation
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,4 +86,11 @@ Example: >lua
       vim.b[bufnr].foo = val
     end
 <
+
+EditorConfig overrides filetype plugins           *editorconfig-vs-ftplugin*

comment_data.body: Line wrap needs to be fixed.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6,7 +6,7 @@
 
 EditorConfig integration                                        *editorconfig*
 
-Nvim supports EditorConfig. When a file is opened, Nvim searches all parent
+Nvim supports EditorConfig. When a file is opened, after running |ftplugin|s, Nvim searches all parent

comment_regular_data.body:
> if the behavior I'm documenting here is actually intentional, or is meant to be guaranteed to users, but it does seem intuitive

FYI, Editorconfig runs on 'BufNewFile', 'BufRead', 'BufFilePost', and the current behavior and ordering is due to BufRead (BufReadPost) taking place *after* FileType, which makes sense because editorconfig can update per-project configs (indentation, etc.), overriding global, default indentation configs (set in filetype plugins).
This has been closed since a request for information has not been answered for 30 days. It can be reopened when the requested information is provided.

title: docs: describe interaction between editorconfig and ftplugin
